channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPARK-6568] spark-shell.cmd --jars option does not accept the jar that has space in its path
item.description:
spark-shell.cmd --jars option does not accept the jar that has space in its path.
The path of jar sometimes containes space in Windows.

bin\spark-shell.cmd --jars "C:\Program Files\some\jar1.jar"

this gets

Exception in thread "main" java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 10: C:/Program Files/some/jar1.jar
item.summary: spark-shell.cmd --jars option does not accept the jar that has space in its path

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Can you show the full stack trace?

bin\spark-shell.cmd --jars "C:\Program Files\some\jar1.jar"

Exception in thread "main" java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 10: C:/Program Files/some/jar1.jar

User 'tsudukim' has created a pull request for this issue:
https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/5347
I removed "Windows" from Components since this is not the problem only for Windows. Same problem also occurs in Linux.

User 'tsudukim' has created a pull request for this issue:
https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/5447

When I try to run the following command the back slashes in the file names get removed and I get an IllegalArgumentException. This is under both Spark 1.3.0 and 1.2.1.

PS C:\Users\jarlhaggerty> C:\spark\bin\pyspark.cmd --master local --jars C:\Users\jarlhaggerty\Miniconda3\envs\py27\Lib\
site-packages\thunder\lib\thunder_2.10-0.5.0.jar --driver-class-path C:\Users\jarlhaggerty\Miniconda3\envs\py27\lib\site
